image.altText: A yellow tram pulls up at a crowded tram stop.

props.synopsis: Labor has "gone cold" on its ambitious plans to revive Adelaide's tram network, as a public transport researcher warns the lack of new routes threatens the city's liveability.

title.children: Labor's tram revival on back burner despite warnings about future traffic congestion in Adelaide

image.altText: Bush at the proposed site of a hydrogen plant.

props.synopsis: It's the game-changing policy Labor didn't hold back on selling ahead of the 2022 SA election. But making a promise in opposition is one thing and actually delivering it in government is another, and the next three months loom as crucial for the hydrogen project's future.

title.children: Is a green hydrogen power play at risk of becoming a mirage in the scrub?

image.altText: Danielle Ponter of the Crows celebrates a goal, hugging her teammates

props.synopsis: AFLW juggernaut Adelaide have extended their unbeaten start to the season, crushing Essendon by 33 points.

title.children: Crows take flight to sink Bombers, Lions clip Eagles' wings with big win

image.altText: smoke pic

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah exchange heavy fire, with Israeli warplanes carrying out the most intense bombardment in almost a year of war across Lebanon's south and Hezbollah firing rockets deep into northern Israel.

title.children: Hezbollah and Israel exchange heavy fire in what Hezbollah says is now an 'open-ended battle of reckoning'

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Among the many words spoken about Palestinians fleeing Gaza in our febrile domestic political debate about visa checks and national security, we have heard very little about the hatred — both private and at times public — that some Gazans feel about and toward Hamas.

title.children: The complicated politics of the Israel-Gaza war continue to mount in Australia

image.altText: An old photograph of basketball players on an indoor court playing a game.

props.synopsis: In 1949, a picture of a basketballer in an American magazine sparked the beginning of Loxton basketball's 75-year journey. Now their story has gone global.

title.children: They went from a grassroots team to champions. Now a film on this small town's basketball team is going global

image.altText: Ken Hinkley looks on while wearing glasses on his head

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide's powerbrokers face a tough decision after another finals exist at the preliminary final stage. Unlocking the path to premiership glory may not be as simple as punting its best-ever coach.

title.children: Premiership-hunting Port Adelaide stuck between a rock and a hard place

image.altText: Senator McKim is mid sentence while standing in the Parliamentary Press Gallery.

props.synopsis: The demand that the treasurer intervene to cut rates unless governor Michele Bullock does so herself effectively sinks Jim Chalmers's chances of passing his reforms.

title.children: Greens demand hostile takeover of RBA in exchange for passing board reforms in likely death knell to treasurer's bill

image.altText: A composite image showing a black-and-white photo of a young woman wearing an ornate hat, and also a wood carving.

props.synopsis: Under the glow of candlelight, on a remote South Australian island, self-taught wood carver Maud Baillie created some of our nation's finest Australiana pieces.

title.children: Teenage girl's 'world-class' wood carvings, created on a remote island 120 years ago, now on display

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Narenda Modi, Joe Biden and Fumio Kishida stand in a line next to each other.

props.synopsis: Here's four things Anthony Albanese's trip revealed about the Quad, leadership, language and life lessons.

title.children: Four takeaways from the prime minister's 48 hours in the US for the Quad

image.altText: Western Sydney housing development Getty

props.synopsis: Perhaps no question matters more to households worn down by cost of living pressures, but the answer is not straightforward.

title.children: Everybody wants to know when rates will be cut. The answer is in these numbers

image.altText: A man with black hair and a short beard smiles widely while waiving at the camera

props.synopsis: The 55-year-old's win comes after he pledged to fight corruption and fix the country's fledgling economy.

title.children: Marxist-leaning Anura Dissanayake elected as Sri Lanka's new president after historic run-off vote

image.altText: Rose Staleo

props.synopsis: The banking royal commission described the way in which mortgage brokers are paid as "conflicted remuneration" and "money for nothing". Customers don't care.

title.children: Mortgage brokers dominating home loan market and infuriating banks

image.altText: Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia

props.synopsis: Four people have died and at least 21 were wounded during a shooting in a nightlife area in Birmingham, Alabama.

title.children: Four killed and dozens wounded in Alabama nightlife district shooting

image.altText: A notebook with the words "Susan Bartlett Suzanne Armstrong murders of 147 Easey St Collingwood"

props.synopsis: Detectives have been praised for collecting and preserving DNA materials during the original Easey Street investigation at a time when little was known about the use of the science in criminal cases.

title.children: Police investigating the Easey Street killings lauded for using a forensic practise that was yet to prove its worth

image.altText: Graphic of Chinese and American flags side by side.

props.synopsis: In the battle for power and influence in Asia, one report says the size of a country's military isn't all that matters.

title.children: China and the US are battling for power in Asia. Which country is on top might surprise you

image.altText: Children hands on fence

props.synopsis: The federal government has tightened its $170 million ABSTUDY funding program following allegations of abuse, fraud and neglect at one Indigenous hostel.

title.children: Indigenous student hostel closes after allegations of abuse, neglect and forced labour

image.altText: Ambulances and workers stand near a mine in Iran

props.synopsis: A gas explosion in a coal mine in Iran's South Khorasan province kills at least 51 people and injures 20.

title.children: Methane blast at Iran coal mine leaves at least 51 dead

image.altText: Two men taking a selfie inside a plane.

props.synopsis: The family of kidnapped New Zealand pilot Phillip Mehrtens expresses thanks to all parties involved in his release, including the Indonesian rebels for taking care of him during more than a year and a half in captivity.

title.children: 'Extremely grateful and relieved': Family reacts to the release of New Zealand pilot kidnapped by Indonesian rebels

image.altText: A small green parrot with a yellow belly and reddy brown eye against a grey background.

props.synopsis: Around half of the nation's total known night parrots live in a patch of the Great Sandy Desert in Western Australia. While dingoes appear to protect them, the potential effects of a proposed road are less clear.

title.children: Australia's largest night parrot population may be protected by dingoes, but mining is planned for their desert home

image.altText: Ben Zygier

props.synopsis: A new documentary aims to shed more light on the case of Prisoner X, who was identified as Australian man Ben Zygier. He'd been working as a spy for Mossad but his alleged crimes remain shrouded in secrecy.

title.children: Who was Prisoner X and how did he come to be locked away in an Israeli prison?

image.altText: Lando Norris holds his index finger up, signifying victory, with fireworks in the background

props.synopsis: Lando Norris has continued McLaren's Formula 1 charge, winning the Singapore Grand Prix and narrowing his deficit to Max Verstappen in the drivers' championship.

title.children: Norris lands another blow to Verstappen in F1 title fight with Singapore win

image.altText: A photo of a clock that has a pink and blue background

props.synopsis: Come October 6, Aussies in NSW, VIC, SA, TAS and the ACT will enjoy an extra hour of evening sunlight.

title.children: When does daylight saving start in 2024? Here's what time the clocks go forward and where

image.altText: An image with a turbine in a circle and farmer in the background

props.synopsis: Large-scale wind and solar farms are coming to the Hay Plain in southern New South Wales and the community is making sure it benefits.

title.children: This community wanted more than 'footy sponsorship' to host large-scale renewable energy projects

image.altText: Ashleigh Gardner of Australia celebrates the wicket of Brooke Halliday, punching the air

props.synopsis: Australia have slammed the brakes on New Zealand to claim their T20 series with a game in hand and inflict a ninth-straight loss on the Kiwis in the format.

title.children: Aussies apply brakes, Kiwis sink to ninth-straight loss

image.altText: Kiera Austin takes a shot on goal while Funmi Fadoju defends.

props.synopsis: Despite being dealt a major injury blow before the game, the Roses spring an upset to beat the Diamonds 61-59 in a thrilling second Test in Sydney.

title.children: Tenacious England pips world champions Australia in dramatic second Test to keep series alive

image.altText: A composite image of the Sydney Swans and Brisbane Lions celebrating making it to the grand final in 2024

props.synopsis: The AFL grand final is happening next weekend. Here's a quick run-down of the basics about the big game.

title.children: What you need to know about the Lions vs Swans AFL grand final

image.altText: Alison Donnan holds up a bit of Tupperware.

props.synopsis: Tupperware's plastic may be famously indestructible, but the US-based company filed for bankruptcy this week. It's cause for reflection from the Australians who sold the containers to party-goers across decades.

title.children: Tupperware's bankruptcy reflects an increasing skepticism around multi-level marketing schemes, experts say

image.altText: A close up of the preserved tree stump, just after it was unearthed from the sand, white beach and blue sky in background.

props.synopsis: Researchers and local Indigenous people say a beautifully preserved metre-wide and 40-centimetres-high tree stump may be a thousand-year-old messenger with a story to share about climate change.

title.children: Why this 7,000-year-old stump could unlock secrets about climate change

image.altText: A hand holding a phone displaying a map

props.synopsis: Since the start of the Gaza war, Israel has been deploying a tactic known as GPS "spoofing", which is designed to fool enemy missiles but has also had detrimental impacts on civilian life.

title.children: In the Middle East, dating apps, food delivery and map navigation are leading everyone to Beirut Airport

image.altText: a group of men look at a BYD car in front of a BYD logo

props.synopsis: Despite tariffs and a slowing global demand for electric vehicles in recent months, China is steaming ahead with its transition to EVs.

title.children: 'The Chinese offensive is visible everywhere': The changing face of the auto industry

image.altText: A woman with a neutral expression looks at the camera. In the background, medical equipment is visible.

props.synopsis: Sholbaana Kuular and her family have firsthand experience with regard to how racist Russian society can be, but a proposed new law that would limit the number of migrant children in classrooms has outlined how discrimination often starts at state level.

title.children: Inside the 'horrible machine' of Russian racism, where bullying starts at state level

image.altText: Saline 1

props.synopsis: One senior clinician at a major Sydney hospital has described the ongoing situation as "a complete sh**show".

title.children: 'You're being asked to act as a gatekeeper': Doctors say they are still being forced to conserve IV fluids

image.altText: The Menendez family and their grisly story gets the Ryan Murphy treatment

props.synopsis: American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy is once again picking from the horrific crimes of the recent past to create his newest mini-series Monsters: The Lyle and Erik Menendez Story.

title.children: Lyle and Erik Menendez murdered their parents in the 1990s. Now Netflix is telling their story
